00018     const float P_PLANAR_EPSILON = 1e-3f; 
00019 
00033     class pDomain
00034     {
00035     public:
00036         virtual bool Within(const pVec &) const = 0; 
00037         virtual pVec Generate() const = 0; 
00038         virtual float Size() const = 0; 
00039 
00040         virtual pDomain *copy() const = 0; // Returns a pointer to a heap-allocated copy of the derived class
00041 
00042         virtual ~pDomain() {}
00043     };
00044 
00053     class PDUnion : public pDomain
00054     {
00055     public:
00056         std::vector<pDomain *> Doms;
00057         float TotalSize;
00058 
00059     public:
00060         PDUnion() 
00061         {
00062             TotalSize = 0.0f;
00063         }
00064 
00065         PDUnion(const pDomain &A, const pDomain &B)
00066         {
00067             TotalSize = A.Size() + B.Size();
00068             Doms.push_back(A.copy());
00069             Doms.push_back(B.copy());
00070         }
00071 
00072         PDUnion(const pDomain &A, const pDomain &B, const pDomain &C)
00073         {
00074             TotalSize = A.Size() + B.Size() + C.Size();
00075             Doms.push_back(A.copy());
00076             Doms.push_back(B.copy());
00077             Doms.push_back(C.copy());
00078         }
00079 
00083         PDUnion(const std::vector<pDomain *> &DomList)
00084         {
00085             TotalSize = 0.0f;
00086             for(std::vector<pDomain *>::const_iterator it = DomList.begin(); it != DomList.end(); it++) {
00087                 Doms.push_back((*it)->copy());
00088                 TotalSize += (*it)->Size();
00089             }
00090         }
00091 
00092         // Makes a copy of all the subdomains and point to the copies.
00093         PDUnion(const PDUnion &P)
00094         {
00095             TotalSize = 0.0f;
00096             for(std::vector<pDomain *>::const_iterator it = P.Doms.begin(); it != P.Doms.end(); it++) {
00097                 Doms.push_back((*it)->copy());
00098                 TotalSize += (*it)->Size();
00099             }
00100         }
00101 
00102         ~PDUnion()
00103         {
00104             for(std::vector<pDomain *>::const_iterator it = Doms.begin(); it != Doms.end(); it++) {
00105                 delete (*it);
00106             }
00107         }
00108 
00110         void insert(const pDomain &A)
00111         {
00112             TotalSize += A.Size();
00113             Doms.push_back(A.copy());
00114         }
00115 
00116         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00117         {
00118             for(std::vector<pDomain *>::const_iterator it = Doms.begin(); it != Doms.end(); it++)
00119                 if((*it)->Within(pos)) return true;
00120             return false;
00121         }
00122 
00123         pVec Generate() const 
00124         {
00125             float Choose = pRandf() * TotalSize, PastProb = 0.0f;
00126             for(std::vector<pDomain *>::const_iterator it = Doms.begin(); it != Doms.end(); it++) {
00127                 PastProb += (*it)->Size();
00128                 if(Choose <= PastProb)
00129                     return (*it)->Generate();
00130             }
00131             throw PErrInternalError("Sizes didn't add up to TotalSize in PDUnion::Generate().");
00132         }
00133 
00134         float Size() const
00135         {
00136             return TotalSize;
00137         }
00138 
00139         pDomain *copy() const
00140         {
00141             PDUnion *P = new PDUnion(*this);
00142             return P;
00143         }
00144     };
00145 
00149     class PDPoint : public pDomain
00150     {
00151     public:
00152         pVec p;
00153 
00154     public:
00155         PDPoint(const pVec &p0)
00156         {
00157             p = p0;
00158         }
00159 
00160         ~PDPoint()
00161         {
00162             // std::cerr << "del " << typeid(*this).name() << this << std::endl;
00163         }
00164 
00165         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00166         {
00167             return p == pos;
00168         }
00169 
00170         pVec Generate() const 
00171         {
00172             return p;
00173         }
00174 
00175         float Size() const
00176         {
00177             return 1.0f;
00178         }
00179 
00180         pDomain *copy() const
00181         {
00182             PDPoint *P = new PDPoint(*this);
00183             return P;
00184         }
00185     };

00192     class PDLine : public pDomain
00193     {
00194     public:
00195         pVec p0, vec, vecNrm;
00196         float len;
00197 
00198     public:
00199         PDLine(const pVec &e0, const pVec &e1)
00200         {
00201             p0 = e0;
00202             vec = e1 - e0;
00203             vecNrm = vec;
00204             vecNrm.normalize();
00205             len = vec.length();
00206         }
00207 
00208         ~PDLine()
00209         {
00210         }
00211 
00212         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00213         {
00214             pVec to = pos - p0;
00215             float d = dot(vecNrm, to);
00216             float dif = fabs(d - to.length()) / len; // Has a sqrt(). Kind of slow.
00217             return dif < 1e-7f; // It's inaccurate, so we need this epsilon.
00218         }
00219 
00220         pVec Generate() const 
00221         {
00222             return p0 + vec * pRandf();
00223         }
00224 
00225         float Size() const
00226         {
00227             return len;
00228         }
00229 
00230         pDomain *copy() const
00231         {
00232             PDLine *P = new PDLine(*this);
00233             return P;
00234         }
00235     };
00236 
00237     // Compute the inverse matrix of the plane basis.
00238     static inline void NewBasis(const pVec &u, const pVec &v, pVec &s1, pVec &s2)
00239     {
00240         pVec w = Cross(u, v);
00241 
00242         float det = 1.0f / (w.z()*u.x()*v.y() - w.z()*u.y()*v.x() - u.z()*w.x()*v.y() - u.x()*v.z()*w.y() + v.z()*w.x()*u.y() + u.z()*v.x()*w.y());
00243 
00244         s1 = pVec((v.y()*w.z() - v.z()*w.y()), (v.z()*w.x() - v.x()*w.z()), (v.x()*w.y() - v.y()*w.x()));
00245         s1 *= det;
00246         s2 = pVec((u.y()*w.z() - u.z()*w.y()), (u.z()*w.x() - u.x()*w.z()), (u.x()*w.y() - u.y()*w.x()));
00247         s2 *= -det;
00248     }
00249 
00255     class PDTriangle : public pDomain
00256     {
00257     public:
00258         pVec p, u, v, uNrm, vNrm, nrm, s1, s2;
00259         float uLen, vLen, D, area;
00260 
00261     public:
00262         PDTriangle(const pVec &p0, const pVec &p1, const pVec &p2)
00263         {
00264             p = p0;
00265             u = p1 - p0;
00266             v = p2 - p0;
00267 
00268             uLen = u.length();
00269             uNrm = u / uLen;
00270             vLen = v.length();
00271             vNrm = v / vLen;
00272 
00273             nrm = Cross(uNrm, vNrm); // This is the non-unit normal.
00274             nrm.normalize(); // Must normalize it.
00275 
00276             D = -dot(p, nrm);
00277 
00278             NewBasis(u, v, s1, s2); // Compute the inverse matrix of the plane basis.
00279 
00280             // Compute the area
00281             pVec Hgt = v - uNrm * dot(uNrm, v);
00282             float h = Hgt.length();
00283             area = 0.5f * uLen * h;
00284         }
00285 
00286         ~PDTriangle()
00287         {
00288         }
00289 
00290         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00291         {
00292             pVec offset = pos - p;
00293             float d = dot(offset, nrm);
00294 
00295             if(d > P_PLANAR_EPSILON) return false;
00296 
00297             // Dot product with basis vectors of old frame
00298             // in terms of new frame gives position in uv frame.
00299             float upos = dot(offset, s1);
00300             float vpos = dot(offset, s2);
00301 
00302             // Did it cross plane outside triangle?
00303             return !(upos < 0 || vpos < 0 || (upos + vpos) > 1);
00304         }
00305 
00306         pVec Generate() const 
00307         {
00308             float r1 = pRandf();
00309             float r2 = pRandf();
00310             pVec pos;
00311             if(r1 + r2 < 1.0f)
00312                 pos = p + u * r1 + v * r2;
00313             else
00314                 pos = p + u * (1.0f-r1) + v * (1.0f-r2);
00315 
00316             return pos;
00317         }
00318 
00319         float Size() const
00320         {
00321             return area;
00322         }
00323 
00324         pDomain *copy() const
00325         {
00326             PDTriangle *P = new PDTriangle(*this);
00327             return P;
00328         }
00329     };
00330 
00336     class PDRectangle : public pDomain
00337     {
00338     public:
00339         pVec p, u, v, uNrm, vNrm, nrm, s1, s2;
00340         float uLen, vLen, D, area;
00341 
00342     public:
00343         PDRectangle(const pVec &p0, const pVec &u0, const pVec &v0)
00344         {
00345             p = p0;
00346             u = u0;
00347             v = v0;
00348 
00349             uLen = u.length();
00350             uNrm = u / uLen;
00351             vLen = v.length();
00352             vNrm = v / vLen;
00353 
00354             nrm = Cross(uNrm, vNrm); // This is the non-unit normal.
00355             nrm.normalize(); // Must normalize it.
00356 
00357             D = -dot(p, nrm);
00358 
00359             NewBasis(u, v, s1, s2); // Compute the inverse matrix of the plane basis.
00360 
00361             // Compute the area
00362             pVec Hgt = v - uNrm * dot(uNrm, v);
00363             float h = Hgt.length();
00364             area = uLen * h;
00365         }
00366 
00367         ~PDRectangle()
00368         {
00369             // std::cerr << "del " << typeid(*this).name() << this << std::endl;
00370         }
00371 
00372         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00373         {
00374             pVec offset = pos - p;
00375             float d = dot(offset, nrm);
00376 
00377             if(d > P_PLANAR_EPSILON) return false;
00378 
00379             // Dot product with basis vectors of old frame
00380             // in terms of new frame gives position in uv frame.
00381             float upos = dot(offset, s1);
00382             float vpos = dot(offset, s2);
00383 
00384             // Did it cross plane outside triangle?
00385             return !(upos < 0 || upos > 1 || vpos < 0 || vpos > 1);
00386         }
00387 
00388         pVec Generate() const 
00389         {
00390             pVec pos = p + u * pRandf() + v * pRandf();
00391             return pos;
00392         }
00393 
00394         float Size() const
00395         {
00396             return area;
00397         }
00398 
00399         pDomain *copy() const
00400         {
00401             PDRectangle *P = new PDRectangle(*this);
00402             return P;
00403         }
00404     };

00411     class PDDisc : public pDomain
00412     {
00413     public:
00414         pVec p, nrm, u, v;
00415         float radIn, radOut, radInSqr, radOutSqr, dif, D, area;
00416 
00417     public:
00418         PDDisc(const pVec &Center, const pVec Normal, const float OuterRadius, const float InnerRadius = 0.0f)
00419         {
00420             p = Center;
00421             nrm = Normal;
00422             nrm.normalize();
00423 
00424             if(InnerRadius < 0) throw PErrInvalidValue("Can't have negative radius.");
00425             if(OuterRadius < 0) throw PErrInvalidValue("Can't have negative radius.");
00426 
00427             if(OuterRadius > InnerRadius) {
00428                 radOut = OuterRadius; radIn = InnerRadius;
00429             } else {
00430                 radOut = InnerRadius; radIn = OuterRadius;
00431             }
00432 
00433             radInSqr = fsqr(radIn);
00434             radOutSqr = fsqr(radOut);
00435             dif = radOut - radIn;
00436 
00437             // Find a vector orthogonal to n.
00438             pVec basis(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
00439             if (fabsf(dot(basis, nrm)) > 0.999f)
00440                 basis = pVec(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
00441 
00442             // Project away N component, normalize and cross to get
00443             // second orthonormal vector.
00444             u = basis - nrm * dot(basis, nrm);
00445             u.normalize();
00446             v = Cross(nrm, u);
00447             D = -dot(p, nrm);
00448 
00449             if(dif == 0.0f)
00450                 area = 2.0f * M_PI * radOut; // Length of circle
00451             else
00452                 area = M_PI * radOutSqr - M_PI * radInSqr; // Area or disc minus hole
00453         }
00454 
00455         ~PDDisc()
00456         {
00457         }
00458 
00459         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00460         {
00461             pVec offset = pos - p;
00462             float d = dot(offset, nrm);
00463 
00464             if(d > P_PLANAR_EPSILON) return false;
00465 
00466             float len = offset.length2();
00467             return len >= radInSqr && len <= radOutSqr;
00468         }
00469 
00470         pVec Generate() const 
00471         {
00472             // Might be faster to generate a point in a square and reject if outside the circle
00473             float theta = pRandf() * 2.0f * float(M_PI); // Angle around normal
00474             // Distance from center
00475             float r = radIn + pRandf() * dif;
00476 
00477             float x = r * cosf(theta); // Weighting of each frame vector
00478             float y = r * sinf(theta);
00479 
00480             pVec pos = p + u * x + v * y;
00481             return pos;
00482         }
00483 
00484         float Size() const
00485         {
00486             return 1.0f; // A plane is infinite, so what sensible thing can I return?
00487         }
00488 
00489         pDomain *copy() const
00490         {
00491             PDDisc *P = new PDDisc(*this);
00492             return P;
00493         }
00494     };
00495 
00501     class PDPlane : public pDomain
00502     {
00503     public:
00504         pVec p, nrm;
00505         float D;
00506 
00507     public:
00508         PDPlane(const pVec &p0, const pVec &Normal)
00509         {
00510             p = p0;
00511             nrm = Normal;
00512             nrm.normalize(); // Must normalize it.
00513             D = -dot(p, nrm);
00514         }
00515 
00516         ~PDPlane()
00517         {
00518         }
00519 
00520         // Distance from plane = n * p + d
00521         // Inside is the positive half-space.
00522         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00523         {
00524             return dot(nrm, pos) >= -D;
00525         }
00526 
00527         // How do I sensibly make a point on an infinite plane?
00528         pVec Generate() const 
00529         {
00530             return p;
00531         }
00532 
00533         float Size() const
00534         {
00535             return 1.0f; // A plane is infinite, so what sensible thing can I return?
00536         }
00537 
00538         pDomain *copy() const
00539         {
00540             PDPlane *P = new PDPlane(*this);
00541             return P;
00542         }
00543     };

00552     class PDBox : public pDomain
00553     {
00554     public:
00555         // p0 is the min corner. p1 is the max corner.
00556         pVec p0, p1, dif;
00557         float vol;
00558 
00559     public:
00560         PDBox(const pVec &e0, const pVec &e1)
00561         {
00562             p0 = e0;
00563             p1 = e1;
00564             if(e1.x() < e0.x()) { p0.x() = e1.x(); p1.x() = e1.x(); }
00565             if(e1.y() < e0.y()) { p0.y() = e1.y(); p1.y() = e1.y(); }
00566             if(e1.z() < e0.z()) { p0.z() = e1.z(); p1.z() = e1.z(); }
00567 
00568             dif = p1 - p0;
00569             vol = dot(dif, pVec(1,1,1));
00570         }
00571 
00572         ~PDBox()
00573         {
00574         }
00575 
00576         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00577         {
00578             return !((pos.x() < p0.x()) || (pos.x() > p1.x()) ||
00579                 (pos.y() < p0.y()) || (pos.y() > p1.y()) ||
00580                 (pos.z() < p0.z()) || (pos.z() > p1.z()));
00581         }
00582 
00583         pVec Generate() const 
00584         {
00585             // Scale and translate [0,1] random to fit box
00586             return p0 + CompMult(pRandVec(), dif);
00587         }
00588 
00589         float Size() const
00590         {
00591             return vol;
00592         }
00593 
00594         pDomain *copy() const
00595         {
00596             PDBox *P = new PDBox(*this);
00597             return P;
00598         }
00599     };
00600 
00606     class PDCylinder : public pDomain
00607     {
00608     public:
00609         pVec apex, axis, u, v; // Apex is one end. Axis is vector from one end to the other.
00610         float radOut, radIn, radOutSqr, radInSqr, radDif, axisLenInvSqr, vol;
00611         bool ThinShell;
00612 
00613     public:
00614         PDCylinder(const pVec &e0, const pVec &e1, const float OuterRadius, const float InnerRadius = 0.0f)
00615         {
00616             apex = e0;
00617             axis = e1 - e0;
00618 
00619             if(InnerRadius < 0) throw PErrInvalidValue("Can't have negative radius.");
00620             if(OuterRadius < 0) throw PErrInvalidValue("Can't have negative radius.");
00621 
00622             if(OuterRadius < InnerRadius) {
00623                 radOut = InnerRadius; radIn = OuterRadius;
00624             } else {
00625                 radOut = OuterRadius; radIn = InnerRadius;
00626             }
00627 
00628             radOutSqr = fsqr(radOut);
00629             radInSqr = fsqr(radIn);
00630 
00631             ThinShell = (radIn == radOut);
00632             radDif = radOut - radIn;
00633 
00634             // Given an arbitrary nonzero vector n, make two orthonormal
00635             // vectors u and v forming a frame [u,v,n.normalize()].
00636             pVec n = axis;
00637             float axisLenSqr = axis.length2();
00638             float len = sqrtf(axisLenSqr);
00639             axisLenInvSqr = axisLenSqr ? (1.0f / axisLenSqr) : 0.0f;
00640             n *= sqrtf(axisLenInvSqr);
00641 
00642             // Find a vector orthogonal to n.
00643             pVec basis(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
00644             if (fabsf(dot(basis, n)) > 0.999f)
00645                 basis = pVec(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
00646 
00647             // Project away N component, normalize and cross to get
00648             // second orthonormal vector.
00649             u = basis - n * dot(basis, n);
00650             u.normalize();
00651             v = Cross(n, u);
00652 
00653             float EndCapArea = M_PI * radOutSqr - M_PI * radInSqr;
00654             if(ThinShell)
00655                 vol = len * 2.0f * M_PI * radOut; // Surface area of cylinder
00656             else
00657                 vol = EndCapArea * len; // Volume of cylindrical shell
00658         }
00659 
00660         ~PDCylinder()
00661         {
00662         }
00663 
00664         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00665         {
00666             // This is painful and slow. Might be better to do quick accept/reject tests.
00667             // Axis is vector from base to tip of the cylinder.
00668             // x is vector from base to pos.
00669             //         x . axis
00670             // dist = ---------- = projected distance of x along the axis
00671             //        axis. axis   ranging from 0 (base) to 1 (tip)
00672             //
00673             // rad = x - dist * axis = projected vector of x along the base
00674 
00675             pVec x = pos - apex;
00676 
00677             // Check axial distance
00678             float dist = dot(axis, x) * axisLenInvSqr;
00679             if(dist < 0.0f || dist > 1.0f)
00680                 return false;
00681 
00682             // Check radial distance
00683             pVec xrad = x - axis * dist; // Radial component of x
00684             float rSqr = xrad.length2();
00685 
00686             return (rSqr >= radInSqr && rSqr <= radOutSqr);
00687         }
00688 
00689         pVec Generate() const 
00690         {
00691             float dist = pRandf(); // Distance between base and tip
00692             float theta = pRandf() * 2.0f * float(M_PI); // Angle around axis
00693             // Distance from axis
00694             float r = radIn + pRandf() * radDif;
00695 
00696             // Another way to do this is to choose a random point in a square and keep it if it's in the circle.
00697             float x = r * cosf(theta);
00698             float y = r * sinf(theta);
00699 
00700             pVec pos = apex + axis * dist + u * x + v * y;
00701             return pos;
00702         }
00703 
00704         float Size() const
00705         {
00706             return vol;
00707         }
00708 
00709         pDomain *copy() const
00710         {
00711             PDCylinder *P = new PDCylinder(*this);
00712             return P;
00713         }
00714     };
00715 
00721     class PDCone : public pDomain
00722     {
00723     public:
00724         pVec apex, axis, u, v; // Apex is one end. Axis is vector from one end to the other.
00725         float radOut, radIn, radOutSqr, radInSqr, radDif, axisLenInvSqr, vol;
00726         bool ThinShell;
00727 
00728     public:
00729         PDCone(const pVec &e0, const pVec &e1, const float OuterRadius, const float InnerRadius = 0.0f)
00730         {
00731             apex = e0;
00732             axis = e1 - e0;
00733 
00734             if(InnerRadius < 0) throw PErrInvalidValue("Can't have negative radius.");
00735             if(OuterRadius < 0) throw PErrInvalidValue("Can't have negative radius.");
00736 
00737             if(OuterRadius < InnerRadius) {
00738                 radOut = InnerRadius; radIn = OuterRadius;
00739             } else {
00740                 radOut = OuterRadius; radIn = InnerRadius;
00741             }
00742 
00743             radOutSqr = fsqr(radOut);
00744             radInSqr = fsqr(radIn);
00745 
00746             ThinShell = (radIn == radOut);
00747             radDif = radOut - radIn;
00748 
00749             // Given an arbitrary nonzero vector n, make two orthonormal
00750             // vectors u and v forming a frame [u,v,n.normalize()].
00751             pVec n = axis;
00752             float axisLenSqr = axis.length2();
00753             float len = sqrtf(axisLenSqr);
00754             axisLenInvSqr = axisLenSqr ? 1.0f / axisLenSqr : 0.0f;
00755             n *= sqrtf(axisLenInvSqr);
00756 
00757             // Find a vector orthogonal to n.
00758             pVec basis(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
00759             if (fabsf(dot(basis, n)) > 0.999f)
00760                 basis = pVec(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
00761 
00762             // Project away N component, normalize and cross to get
00763             // second orthonormal vector.
00764             u = basis - n * dot(basis, n);
00765             u.normalize();
00766             v = Cross(n, u);
00767 
00768             if(ThinShell)
00769                 vol = sqrtf(axisLenSqr + radOutSqr) * M_PI * radOut; // Surface area of cone (not counting endcap)
00770             else {
00771                 float OuterVol = 0.33333333f * M_PI * radOutSqr * len; 
00772                 float InnerVol = 0.33333333f * M_PI * radInSqr * len;
00773                 vol = OuterVol - InnerVol; // Volume of conical shell
00774             }
00775         }
00776 
00777         ~PDCone()
00778         {
00779         }
00780 
00781         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00782         {
00783             // This is painful and slow. Might be better to do quick
00784             // accept/reject tests.
00785             // Let axis = vector from base to tip of the cone
00786             // x = vector from base to test point
00787             //         x . axis
00788             // dist = ---------- = projected distance of x along the axis
00789             //        axis. axis   ranging from 0 (base) to 1 (tip)
00790             //
00791             // rad = x - dist * axis = projected vector of x along the base
00792 
00793             pVec x = pos - apex;
00794 
00795             // Check axial distance
00796             // axisLenInvSqr stores 1 / dot(axis, axis)
00797             float dist = dot(axis, x) * axisLenInvSqr;
00798             if(dist < 0.0f || dist > 1.0f)
00799                 return false;
00800 
00801             // Check radial distance; scale radius along axis for cones
00802             pVec xrad = x - axis * dist; // Radial component of x
00803             float rSqr = xrad.length2();
00804 
00805             return (rSqr >= fsqr(dist * radIn) && rSqr <= fsqr(dist * radOut));
00806         }
00807 
00808         pVec Generate() const 
00809         {
00810             float dist = pRandf(); // Distance between base and tip
00811             float theta = pRandf() * 2.0f * float(M_PI); // Angle around axis
00812             // Distance from axis
00813             float r = radIn + pRandf() * radDif;
00814 
00815             // Another way to do this is to choose a random point in a square and keep it if it's in the circle.
00816             float x = r * cosf(theta);
00817             float y = r * sinf(theta);
00818 
00819             // Scale radius along axis for cones
00820             x *= dist;
00821             y *= dist;
00822 
00823             pVec pos = apex + axis * dist + u * x + v * y;
00824             return pos;
00825         }
00826 
00827         float Size() const 
00828         {
00829             return vol;
00830         }
00831 
00832         pDomain *copy() const
00833         {
00834             PDCone *P = new PDCone(*this);
00835             return P;
00836         }
00837     };
00838 
00844     class PDSphere : public pDomain
00845     {
00846     public:
00847         pVec ctr;
00848         float radOut, radIn, radOutSqr, radInSqr, radDif, vol;
00849         bool ThinShell;
00850 
00851     public:
00852         PDSphere(const pVec &Center, const float OuterRadius, const float InnerRadius = 0.0f)
00853         {
00854             ctr = Center;
00855 
00856             if(InnerRadius < 0) throw PErrInvalidValue("Can't have negative radius.");
00857             if(OuterRadius < 0) throw PErrInvalidValue("Can't have negative radius.");
00858 
00859             if(OuterRadius < InnerRadius) {
00860                 radOut = InnerRadius; radIn = OuterRadius;
00861             } else {
00862                 radOut = OuterRadius; radIn = InnerRadius;
00863             }
00864 
00865             radOutSqr = fsqr(radOut);
00866             radInSqr = fsqr(radIn);
00867 
00868             ThinShell = (radIn == radOut);
00869             radDif = radOut - radIn;
00870 
00871             if(ThinShell)
00872                 vol = 4.0f * M_PI * radOutSqr; // Surface area of sphere
00873             else {
00874                 float OuterVol = 1.33333333f * M_PI * radOutSqr * radOut; 
00875                 float InnerVol = 1.33333333f * M_PI * radInSqr * radIn;
00876                 vol = OuterVol - InnerVol; // Volume of spherical shell
00877             }
00878         }
00879 
00880         ~PDSphere()
00881         {
00882         }
00883 
00884         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00885         {
00886             pVec rvec(pos - ctr);
00887             float rSqr = rvec.length2();
00888             return rSqr <= radOutSqr && rSqr >= radInSqr;
00889         }
00890 
00891         pVec Generate() const 
00892         {
00893             pVec pos;
00894 
00895             do {
00896                 pos = pRandVec() - vHalf; // Point on [-0.5,0.5] box
00897             } while (pos.length2() > fsqr(0.5)); // Make sure it's also on r=0.5 sphere.
00898             pos.normalize(); // Now it's on r=1 spherical shell
00899 
00900             // Scale unit sphere pos by [0..r] and translate
00901             if(ThinShell) // I can't remember why I make this distinction. Is it for precision or speed? Speed doesn't seem likely.
00902                 pos = ctr + pos * radOut;
00903             else
00904                 pos = ctr + pos * (radIn + pRandf() * radDif);
00905 
00906             return pos;
00907         }
00908 
00909         float Size() const 
00910         {
00911             return vol;
00912         }
00913 
00914         pDomain *copy() const
00915         {
00916             PDSphere *P = new PDSphere(*this);
00917             return P;
00918         }
00919     };
00920 
00926     class PDBlob : public pDomain
00927     {
00928     public:
00929         pVec ctr;
00930         float stdev, Scale1, Scale2;
00931 
00932     public:
00933         PDBlob(const pVec &Center, const float StandardDev)
00934         {
00935             ctr = Center;
00936             stdev = StandardDev;
00937             float oneOverSigma = 1.0f/(stdev+0.000000000001f);
00938             Scale1 = -0.5f*fsqr(oneOverSigma);
00939             Scale2 = P_ONEOVERSQRT2PI * oneOverSigma;
00940         }
00941 
00942         ~PDBlob()
00943         {
00944         }
00945 
00946         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00947         {
00948             pVec x = pos - ctr;
00949             float Gx = expf(x.length2() * Scale1) * Scale2;
00950             return (pRandf() < Gx);
00951         }
00952 
00953         pVec Generate() const 
00954         {
00955             return ctr + pNRandVec(stdev);
00956         }
00957 
00958         float Size() const 
00959         {
00960             return 1.0f;
00961         }
00962 
00963         pDomain *copy() const
00964         {
00965             PDBlob *P = new PDBlob(*this);
00966             return P;
00967         }
00968     };
00969 
00970 };
00971 
00972 #endif
